Another breadth chart for global equities - one for the risk monitor: breadth of "Death Crosses" i.e. when 50dma goes below 200dma.  Basically it shows the proportion of 70 stockmarkets which are more or less in a downtrend or falling significantly.  Can* serve as early warning

The problem with saying CreditSpreads are 'too low' is that you can get periods like 04-07 where you'd get steam-rolled being short on valuation rationale.  So indicators like this help save me from throwing my pendulum until the time is right...

Easy monetary policy (rate cuts and QE) are typically good for gold, tighter monetary policy is not so good.  But broader issue here is that the transition from QE to QT in the US (and the cessation/taper of QE by ECB/BOJ) could create some turbulence across markets...
Yeah, they've made it fairly clear they will be importing US monetary policy - which is the last thing they need, so will be interesting indeed

Yeah the FX vol is massive - it would be like billing a client in Venezuelan bolivar

My biggest issue with crypto (and I may be missing something): as a business owner I don't see any practical advantage of Bitcoin vs paypal as a means of accepting payments (or IMT/TT for that matter!).
